name: Namibian Aviation Training Academy (NATA)
about: The Namibian Aviation Training Academy (NATA), established as a subsidiary of the renowned German aviation company Dornier, has been a leader in aviation training for over 23 years. Founded in 2000 and initially based at Keetmanshoop airport, NATA now operates from Eros Airport in Windhoek. The academy offers comprehensive training programs, including courses for private pilot licenses, night ratings, instrument ratings, and commercial pilot licenses. NATA integrates advanced training aids, computer-based training, and continuous performance monitoring to ensure the highest standards of instruction. With a strong focus on safety, professionalism, and excellence, NATA contributes significantly to the development of human capital and skills crucial to the aviation industry, supporting the economic and social development of Namibia and the broader African region. NATA is committed to fostering a collaborative spirit that drives progress and innovation in aviation training.
services:
["PRIVATE PILOT LICENSE
NIGHT RATING
INSTRUMENT RATING
COMMERCIAL PILOT LICENSE
INSTRUCTOR RATING
LICENSE RENEWAL
VALIDATION AND/OR CONVERSION OF A FOREIGN LICENSE
MULTI-ENGINE RATING
AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE ENGINEER"]
